article: Years ago while lying in my hammock and drinking JB from the bottle, I _ my dog dragging something under the fence. _ looking at it carefully, to my _ , I realized it was the next-door neighbor's 10-year-old daughter's rabbit. For years I had watched her come home from school and _ straight out to its cage, _ it and play with it in the yard. I know today _ be no different. Fearing for our dog, I had to think fast. The rabbit died and was quite dirty, as if it had put up quite a struggle, so I washed it off with the plastic _ , combed it with the dog brush and blew it _ with the leaf blower . Upon finishing its grooming , I jumped the _ and put it back in its cage hoping its _ would be accepted as " natural causes". _ to the hammock and JB. Within the hour the neighbor's car pulled in as usual and out came the little girl, _ as usual she headed straight for the cage. Only this time did she stop about six feet away and _ " D-A-D-D-Y-!!" Her father, _ , stood looking at the cage. Being the good neighbor, I rushed to the fence and asked if there was anything I could do. Her father less than calmly shouted, "What kind of _ person would dig up a little girl's dead rabbit and put it back in its cage?"
